snippet: Feniosky Peña-Mora, hired in 2009 to run the engineering school, faced criticism from faculty members who said he was expanding the school too fast and prioritizing fund-raising over research.
abstract: Dr Feniosky Pena-Mora, Columbia University dean, resigns; he faced strong criticism from faculty members over his rapid expansion of the school's engineering programs, and was accused of prioritizing fund-raising over research; his departure comes at a delicate time for the school, which is trying to raise its profile in the sciences.
lead_paragraph: Feniosky Peña-Mora, hired in 2009 to run the engineering school, faced criticism from faculty members who said he was expanding the school too fast and prioritizing fund-raising over research.

headline.seo: Feniosky Peña-Mora, Columbia Engineering Dean, Steps Down
headline.main: After Revolt, a Dean at Columbia Steps Down
headline.print_headline: Dean Quits At Columbia After Revolt By Faculty
